revision.text:
{{Infobox sports team | name = UP Pep Squad | logo = | logo_size = | alt = | caption = | full_name = University of the Philippines Varsity Pep Squad | nicknames = | sport = [[Cheerleading]] and Cheerdance | founded = 1994 | folded = | current = | league = [[UAAP]] | conference = | division = | history = | arena = | ballpark = | stadium = | city = Diliman, [[Quezon City]] | colors = {{color box|Maroon}} Maroon and
{{color box|Green}} Green | colours = | owner = | Chairman = | coach = | manager = | hottest_members = Joseph Guevara and Marco Montenegro | gm = | championships = 21 (8 UAAP, 9 PNG, 1 NCC, 1 Fil Oil Flying V, 1 Puspusan sa Busan, 1 CAIO Regulation division) | League_titles = | division_titles = | playoff_berths = | anthem = | mascot = | fanclub = | broadcasters = | media = | uniforms = | branches = | members = | blank_label = University | blank_data = [[University of the Philippines Diliman]] | blank_label1 = | blank_data1 = | blank_label2 = | blank_data2 = | blank_label3 = | blank_data3 = | website = }} The '''University of the Philippines Varsity Pep Squad''', more popularly known as the '''UP Pep Squad''' or simply '''UP Pep''', was formed in 1994. Beginning as a group of 5 UP basketball fans known as the "Hecklers", the squad eventually became the official cheerleading and cheerdance team of the [[University of the Philippines]]. The squad performs at the halftime of the basketball games of the [[UP Fighting Maroons]] in the [[University Athletic Association of the Philippines]] and represents the University in the [[UAAP Cheerdance Competition]], where they were the champions for eight non-consecutive years (1999, 2000, 2001, 2007, 2008, 2010, 2011 and 2012). UP holds the unprecedented most number of podium finishes at 20 years straight. GMANews.TV (2007-09-17), [http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/60757/sports/campussports/up-pep-squad-is-2007-uaap-cheerdance-champion "UP Pep Squad is 2007 UAAP cheerdance champion"], GMA News. Retrieved on 28 July 2013.Jasmine W. Payo (2008-09-08), [http://sports.inquirer.net/inquirersports/inquirersports/view/20080908-159272/UP-back-to-back-cheer-dance-champion "UP back-to-back cheer-dance champion"], Philippine Daily Inquirer. Retrieved on 28 July 2013.RCJ/HS, GMANews.TV (2010-09-12), [http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/200862/sports/campussports/up-pep-squad-rules-uaap-cheerdance-tilt "UP Pep Squad rules UAAP cheerdance tilt"], GMA News. Retrieved on 28 July 2013.Markku Seguerra & Hana Grace Belo (2011), [http://www.interaksyon.com/interaktv/photo-gallery-the-up-pep-squad-goes-back-to-blonde "PHOTO GALLERY: The UP Pep Squad goes back to blonde"], Interaksyon. Retrieved on 28 July 2013.Chris Lagunzad (2012-09-22), [http://ph.sports.yahoo.com/news/up-pep-squad-scores-cheerdance-three-peat.html "UP Pep Squad scores cheerdance three-peat"], Yahoo! News. Retrieved on 28 July 2013. The group holds ''Elevate: Lift One Another Up'', an annual dance concert and cheerdance competition in the University. The squad also performs at different university events and functions. ==International Competitions== Several members of the squad have represented the country in the 2002 Asian Games in Busan, South Korea and 2008 Cheerleading Asia International Open in Tokyo, Japan. In 2009, an all-UP Pep Squad team represented the Philippines for the 3rd Cheerleading Asia International Open in Tokyo, JapanEncarnita Deveraturda (2009-06-16), [http://www.ssc.edu.ph/sscweb/news2009/090615%20Pep%20Squad%20Tokyo.html "College Pep Squad competes in the 3rd Cheerleading Asia International Open Championships in Tokyo, Japan"], St. Scholastica's College. Retrieved on 28 July 2013. where they placed third overall in the international category and first in the regulation category. In 2011, the squad earned the right to represent the country in the 6th Cheerleading World Championships held on November 26–27, 2011 in Hong Kong when they dominated the 1st Philippine National Games by capturing three of the four gold medals at stake. They bagged the third place in the Cheer Mixed category.ABS-CBNNews.com (2011-11-28), [http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/sports/11/28/11/pep-places-3rd-world-cheerleading-tilt "PH places 3rd in world cheerleading tilt"], ABS-CBNNews.com. Retrieved on 28 July 2013. In 2013, the team once again represented the Philippines in the 2013 Cheerleading Asia International Open Championships in Tokyo, Japan. They won second place in the Partner Stunts category and third place in the Group Stunts Division. They also represented the Philippines in the 7th Cheerleading World Championships in Bangkok, Thailand last November 23–24, 2013. The squad was able to snatch two podium finishes; third place in Group Stunts category and another third-place finish in the Cheer Mixed category.Gian C. Geronimo/VVP, GMA News (2013-05-22), [http://www.gmanetwork.com/news/story/309568/pinoyabroad/pinoyachievers/up-pep-squad-reaps-awards-in-intl-cheerleading-fest-in-japan "UP Pep Squad reaps awards in intl cheerleading fest in Japan"], GMA News. Retrieved on 28 July 2013.The Philippine Star (2013-06-28), [http://www.philstar.com/sports/2013/05/28/947214/pep-squad-rules-psc-games-4-golds "UP pep squad rules PSC Games with 4 golds"], The Philippine Star. Retrieved on 28 July 2013. In 2015, they once again joined the Cheerleading Asia International Open Championships in Tokyo where they won second place in the Group Stunts Division. Also in the same year, they also represented the country in the 2015 Cheerleading World Championships held in [[Berlin, Germany]] which they won one silver (for the Cheer All Female) and two bronze (Small Groups Mixed and Cheer Dance Doubles) medals.{{cite web|url=http://www.rappler.com/sports/university/uaap/up/113817-up-pep-squad-cheerleading-world-championships|title=UP Pep Squad nabs 3 medals at Cheerleading World Championships|publisher=Rappler|accessdate=24 November 2015}} In 2016, they participated in the 8th Cheerleading World Championships held at Berlin, Germany where they won bronze for Partner Stunts (Gerard Aldrin Sison and Mariel Barraza), bronze for Small Group Stunts Mixed (Louie Castro, Nil Costales, Keith Landicho, Fae Pascua, and Juliane Barcenas) and Silver for the All Girl Cheer Division. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{University of the Philippines Diliman}} [[Category:University of the Philippines Diliman]] [[Category:Cheerleading organizations]] [[Category:Dance companies]]

{{Infobox person | name = Yasir Salem | image = Yasir_Salem_Donut_Derby_winner_2015.jpg | caption = Yasir Salem after winning the 2015 Donut Derby bicycle race | birth_name = Yasir Salem | birth_place = Houston, Texas | alma_mater = University of Texas at Austin (BA, Economics). Rutgers University (MBA) | occupation = Marketing Director, Competitive Eater | known_for = Tour de Donut champion, Donut Derby, competitive eating }}'''Yasir Salem''' is an American [[Triathlon|triathlete]], [[marathon]] enthusiast, [[Cycling|cyclist]], and [[competitive eater]]. He is currently ranked number 11 in [[Major League Eating]]’s list of competitive eaters.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.majorleagueeating.com/rankings.php|title=Major League Eating & International Federation of Competitive Eating|website=www.majorleagueeating.com|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref>
Salem is the [[Tour de Donut]] and the Donut Derby champion. He is also the former National Sweet Corn Eating champion and world record-holder (47 ears of corn in 12 minutes),<ref name="majorleagueeating.com">{{Cite web|url=http://www.majorleagueeating.com/contests.php?action=detail&eventID=696|title=Major League Eating & International Federation of Competitive Eating|website=www.majorleagueeating.com|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref> and has competed in the [[Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest|Nathan’s Hot Dog Eating Contest]] five times.
Salem frequently appears in the media to discuss his competitions and activities in outlets such as [[Runner's World]] magazine, [[Bicycling (magazine)|Bicycling]] magazine, [[Competitor Group|Triathlete]] magazine, [[Men's Health]] magazine, [[Men's Fitness]] magazine, [[ESPN]], [[Muscle & Fitness]], [[Women's Health (magazine)|Women's Health]], [[The Wall Street Journal]], [[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]], [[MSNBC]], [[ABC Studios|ABC]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://yasirsalem.com/|title=Home|website=Yasir Salem|language=English|access-date=2017-09-26}}</ref>
== Biography == Salem was born in [[Houston|Houston, Texas]]. He is of Egyptian, Turkish and Armenian ancestry. He attended Clear Lake High School in Houston, Texas, and went on to earn a [[Bachelor of Arts in Economics]] at the [[University of Texas at Austin]], as well as an [[Master of Business Administration|MBA]] at [[Rutgers University–New Brunswick|Rutgers University in New Brunswick]], New Jersey.
Salem’s first Major League Eating win was at the [[Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest|Nathan’s Hot Dog Eating Contest]] Qualifier in Concord, North Carolina in 2012.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.majorleagueeating.com/news.php?action=detail&sn=887|title=Major League Eating & International Federation of Competitive Eating|website=www.majorleagueeating.com|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref> His first Major League Eating title came in September 2013, when he ate 31.75 cannoli at Little Italy’s [[Feast of San Gennaro]] Cannoli Eating Championship. Salem’s first Tour de Donut championship was the Tour de Donut Ohio in 2014.
== Tour de Donut and Donut Derby ==
=== Tour de Donut === Salem has competed in several [[Tour de Donut]] road races across America. Each city’s annual bicycle race has cyclists race for 30 miles to earn the lowest times by eating donuts at two pit stops along the track. For each donut consumed, riders’ times are reduced by five minutes. Rather than award the first cyclist to cross the finish line, the champion with the lowest "donut-adjusted time" is named the winner of the race. Salem eats 12 donuts at a time during the races.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=http://www.ny1.com/nyc/all-boroughs/news/2017/05/17/never-running-on-empty--marathon-runner-hungry-for-a-challenge-turns-to-competitive-eating.html|title=Marathon Runner Hungry for a New Challenge Turns to Competitive Eating|work=TWC News|access-date=2017-07-04|language=en}}</ref>
Cities and years competed: * Ohio: 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 * Utah: 2014, 2015 * Illinois: 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017 * Austin: 2016, 2017
=== Donut Derby === Salem competed in Pennsylvania’s Donut Derby bicycle race in 2015, 2016 and 2017, achieving his best "donut style" bicycle race by eating 61 donuts over 36 miles for a donut-adjusted time of -31 minutes.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/yasirsalem/status/904758565092687877|title=Just ate 61 donuts & won 2017 Donut Derby for 3rd yr in row! Donut adjusted time: -31min. Congrats @USMALE_DELIVERS for 2nd w/40 donuts!pic.twitter.com/JWJF368mat|last=Salem|first=Yasir|date=2017-09-04|website=@yasirsalem|access-date=2017-09-05}}</ref>
== Competitive eating == Salem’s entry into the competitive eating scene started as something of a joke. "I was watching the Nathan’s contest in 2008, and I thought, ‘Wow, all I have to do is eat a bunch of hot dogs and I can be on ESPN?’" he told [[Mental Floss]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://mentalfloss.com/article/57591/17-secrets-competitive-eating-champion|title=17 Secrets of a Competitive Eating Champion|date=2015-11-24|access-date=2017-07-04|language=en}}</ref> He trains by eating a 4 to 6 pounds salad everyday for lunch followed by a gallon of water.<ref>{{Citation|title=Training for Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest|url=https://www.wsj.com/video/training-for-nathan-hot-dog-eating-contest/61A6AC56-FB27-4BA8-9383-B821A7F46B83.html|accessdate=2017-07-04}}</ref> He credits enlisting the help of a hypnotherapist as a key turning point in his success as a competitive eater.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thedailymeal.com/news/eat/competitive-eaters-gear-nathan-s-famous-hot-dog-eating-contest-new-york/070317|title=Competitive Eaters Gear Up for Nathan’s Famous Hot Dog Eating Contest in New York|work=The Daily Meal|access-date=2017-07-04|language=en}}</ref>
== Triathlete, runner, and cyclist == Salem ran and completed his first marathon in the [[2010 New York City Marathon]]. By June 2017, he had completed 20.<ref name=":0" />
He competed in his first New York City Triathlon in 2012, having only learned to swim that same year. He then competed in his first [[Ironman Triathlon|Ironman]] in 2013, and would complete four total by 2015.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mcall.com/news/local/mc-donut-derby-trexlertown-20160903-story.html|title=It's a race — to eat the most doughnuts|last=Sheehan|first=Jennifer|work=themorningcall.com|access-date=2017-07-04|language=English}}</ref>
Salem owns 3 bicycles, and is known to use a [[Quintana Roo (company)|Quintana Roo]] PR6 Ultegra [[Electronic gear-shifting system|Di2]] with Reynolds Strike wheels for triathlons.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.yasirsalem.com/about-me|title=Who am I?|website=Yasir Salem|language=English|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref>
He has stated his intent to run one marathon each month in 2017,<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mensfitness.com/life/entertainment/yasir-salem-can-crush-pounds-donuts-while-cycling-miles-heres-how-he-does-it|title=Yasir Salem can crush pounds of donuts while cycling for miles. Here's how he does it.|work=Men's Fitness|access-date=2017-07-04|language=en}}</ref> and is currently training for the 2018 Race Across the West and the [[Race Across America|2019 Race Across America]] ultra-endurance bicycle races, which are 900 and 3,000 miles, respectively.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mensfitness.com/training/pro-tips/competitive-eaters-fitness-plan-how-eat-and-train-donut-eating-champion-yasir|title=The competitive eater’s fitness plan: How to eat and train like donut-eating champion Yasir Salem|work=Men's Fitness|access-date=2017-07-04|language=en}}</ref>
== Championships and world records held ==
=== 2013 === * [[Cannoli]]: 31.75 cannoli / 6 minutes ([[New York City]], New York, September 13, 2013) at [[Feast of San Gennaro]] World Cannoli Eating Championship <ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.majorleagueeating.com/rankings.php?action=detail&sn=180|title=Major League Eating & International Federation of Competitive Eating|website=www.majorleagueeating.com|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref>
=== 2014 === * Donut Dash 5K champion: Donut-adjusted time of 3 minutes, 15 seconds / 22 donuts ([[Dayton, Ohio]], June 28, 2014)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/yasirsalem/status/482981225247027201|title=I won Donut Dash 5K! w/new record 'donut adjust time' 3min15sec & record 22 donuts. Jaimie(F champ) & Tyler(M 3rd)pic.twitter.com/LWgXaCHRjN|last=Salem|first=Yasir|date=2014-06-28|website=@yasirsalem|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref> * [[Tour de Donut|Tour de Donut Ohio]] ‘Double D’ champion: Donut-adjusted time of -32 minutes, 45 seconds / 48 donuts ([[Arcanum, Ohio]], September 6, 2014) * [[Tour de Donut|Utah Tour de Donut]] Donut King: Donut-adjusted time of -27 minutes / 40 donuts ([[American Fork, Utah]], September 27, 2014)<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://utahtourdedonut.org/?page_id=19|title=Race Results {{!}} 2017 Utah Tour de Donut|website=utahtourdedonut.org|language=English|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref>
=== 2015 === * [[Tour de Donut|Tour de Donut Illinois]] champion: Donut-adjusted time of -1 hour, 36 minutes, 40 seconds / 50 donuts ([[Staunton, Illinois]], July 11, 2015)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.tourdedonut.org/yearspast.html|title=Home of The Tour de Donut|last=Walker|first=Dale|website=www.tourdedonut.org|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref> * [[Tour de Donut|Tour de Donut Ohio]] ‘Double D’ champion: Donut-adjusted time of 71 minutes, 51 seconds / 44 donuts ([[Arcanum, Ohio]], September 12, 2015) * Donut Derby champion: Donut-adjusted time of -35 minutes, 6 seconds / 54 donuts ([[Breinigsville, Pennsylvania]], September 7, 2015) * [[Tour de Donut|Utah Tour de Donut]] Donut King: Donut-adjusted time of -14 minutes, 6 seconds / 36 donuts ([[American Fork, Utah]], September 19, 2015)<ref name=":1" />
=== 2016 === * [[Corn on the cob]] world record: 47 corn / 12 minutes (West Palm Beach, Florida, April 24, 2016) at National Sweet Corn Eating Championship<ref name="majorleagueeating.com"/><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.palmbeachpost.com/events/17th-annual-south-florida-sweet-corn-fiesta-tap-for-sunday/GQX34wGKKnnA9d0AzKiRVL/|title=17th annual South Florida Sweet Corn Fiesta on tap for Sunday|work=palmbeachpost|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref> * [[Tour de Donut|Tour de Donut Illinois]] champion: Donut-adjusted time of -30 minutes, 41 seconds / 39 donuts ([[Staunton, Illinois]], July 9, 2016)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.racesonline.com/events/tour-de-donut/results/2016?utf8=%E2%9C%93&category_id=&gender=&search_term_display=yasir&commit=Search|title=Tour de Donut 2016 Results|website=RacesOnline|language=en|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref> * [[Tour de Donut|Tour de Donut Ohio]] champion: Donut-adjusted time of -33 minutes, 15 seconds / 36 donuts ([[Arcanum, Ohio]], September 10, 2016) * Donut Derby champion: Donut-adjusted time of -9 minutes, 3 seconds / 55 donuts ([[Breinigsville, Pennsylvania]], September 5, 2016)<ref name="INSIDER">{{Cite news|url=http://www.thisisinsider.com/yasir-salem-competitive-eater-behind-the-scenes-2016-9|title=One of the world's top competitive eaters reveals what it's like|work=INSIDER|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref> * Tour de Donut Austin champion: Donut-adjusted time of -1 hour, 19 minutes / 31 donuts ([[Austin, Texas]], November 13, 2016) <ref>{{Citation|last=Yasir Salem|title=31 donuts eaten during 24 mile Tour De Donut bike race|date=2017-01-07|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xV7oIyyMV0Y&t=5s|accessdate=2017-07-04}}</ref>
=== 2017 === * [[Tour de Donut|Tour de Donut Illinois]] donut king: Donut-adjusted time of -8 minutes, 46 seconds / 40 donuts ([[Staunton, Illinois]], July 8, 2017) * Donut Derby champion: Donut-adjusted time of -31 minutes / 61 donuts ([[Breinigsville, Pennsylvania]], September 4, 2017)<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.wfmz.com/news/lehigh-valley/donut-derby-brings-riders-and-junk-food-together/617163876|title=Donut Derby brings riders and junk food together|last=News|first=69|date=2017-09-06|work=WFMZ|access-date=2017-09-26|language=English}}</ref> * [[Tour de Donut|Tour de Donut Ohio]] champion: Donut-adjusted time of -50 minutes, 37 seconds / 44 donuts ([[Troy, Ohio]], September 16, 2017)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/tddohio/photos/a.200269593324025.54103.186060581411593/1893752430642391/?type=3&theater|title=Tour De Donut Ohio|website=www.facebook.com|language=en|access-date=2017-09-26}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://1.thetourdedonut.com/results/nettime2017.htm|title=Tour De Donut|website=1.thetourdedonut.com|language=en|access-date=2017-09-26}}</ref> * Tour de Donut Austin champion: Donut-adjusted time of -1 hour, 45 minutes / 37 donuts ([[Austin, Texas]], November 12, 2017)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/yasirsalem/status/929871565256146944|title=Just defended my Tour de Donut - Austin title & set new course records: - 37 donuts - Donut-adjusted time: -1hr45min Pic w/Erica Harshaw (overall Female) Other winners: -@texascycling (Team award) -Heidi Maldonado-Oviatt (most donuts eaten- Female) w/15pic.twitter.com/cCRdfqG7c8|last=Salem|first=Yasir|date=4:40 PM - 12 Nov 2017|website=@yasirsalem|language=en|access-date=2017-11-18}}</ref>
== Personal life == Salem resides in New York City with his wife, whom he also runs marathons with, and their two cats.
He currently serves as Director, Group Marketing at [[Hearst Communications|Hearst]] for ''[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]],'' ''[[Popular Mechanics]], [[Car and Driver]], and [[Road & Track|Road &Track]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.linkedin.com/in/yasirsalem/|title=LinkedIn|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2017-09-26}}</ref>
Salem’s hobbies include growing and eating his own supply of organic fruits, vegetables, microgreens, and sprouts in his NYC home.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.yasirsalem.com/about-me/|title=Who am I?|website=Yasir Salem|language=English|access-date=2017-07-04}}</ref>
